title: Print, "The Picnic Excursion from Appleton's Journal, August 14, 1869, p. 624", August 14, 1869
medium:
Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
Support: paper
signed: Signed on block, lower left: H
inscribed: Caption: THE PICNIC EXCURSION. BY WINSLOW HOMER.
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description:
Horizontal view of two groups of men and women setting out in two three-seated White Mountain wagons.  In the right foreground, a kneeling gentleman holds a bottle of wine and a basket while two ladies stand by.  This gentleman is believed to be a self portrait by Homer.  A dog rests in the grass on the left.  

[Above information taken from: David Tatham, Winslow Homer and the Pictorial Press (Syracuse: Syracuse University Press, 2003), p. 44.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The Picnic Excursion from Appleton's Journal, August 14, 1869, p. 624", August 14, 1869.
August 14, 1869. Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
Support: paper. Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-50.
